meanings.definition: The act of setting and arranging type for printing.
meanings.sent1: I enjoy typographing my school projects to make them look neat and organized.
meanings.sent2: The typographing of the book cover made it stand out on the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The typographing of the menu made the restaurant look more professional.
meanings.sent4: Her typographing skills were like a well-orchestrated dance on the page.
meanings.sent5: The art of typographing requires attention to detail and creativity.

meanings.definition: The process of designing and arranging typefaces for printed material.
meanings.sent1: Learning about typographing helped me understand the importance of font choice.
meanings.sent2: The typographing of the poster made the information easy to read.
meanings.sent3: His typographing of the invitation was so elegant that everyone admired it.
meanings.sent4: The typographing of the logo was the key to the company's branding success.
meanings.sent5: Good typographing can make a huge difference in how a message is received.
